channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12267] Replace HTable constructor in mapreduce.* classes with ConnectionFactory
item.summary: Replace HTable constructor in mapreduce.* classes with ConnectionFactory

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Initial commit of M/R replacement of HTable() with connection.getTable().

This message is automatically generated.
I didn't have the rest project in my environment. Fixed a compilation problem.

public void close(TaskAttemptContext context) throws IOException {

-      for (HTable table : tables.values()) {

+      for (Pair<Connection, Table> pair : tables.values()) {

+        Table table = pair.getSecond();

         table.flushCommits();

+        table.close();

+        pair.getFirst().close();

Why do we need to close the Connection ?
Ted Yu: In the brave new world driven by Connection.getTable(), closing the table doesn't close the connection.

This message is automatically generated.

We need this Solomon Duskis?

setClearBufferOnFail

When would it be used?

FYI, we don't put try and first statement in clause on one line as below

try (Connection conn = ConnectionFactory.createConnection(conf);

Is there an accompanying finally to match the above try in IntegrationTestBulkLoad.java? (Might be just the way this patch rendors....)

Just remove the below

// private Table table;

Skimmed the patch. LGTM.

stack

Re setClearBufferOnFail:

It's there to possibly replace HTable.setAutoFlush(boolean autoFlush, boolean clearBufferOnFail) which does not exist on Table. The clearBufferOnFail is set in a whole bunch of places where autoFlush is set to false... i.e. setAutoFlush(false, true). I'm not sure if Table.setClearBufferOnFail(true) is the way to go, but it might work. Is that something worth exposing?

Re: try(...)

There are a lot of Closables to close in the brave new world of Connection -> Table / RegionLocator / Admin world. Any Closables created in the try(...) section are automatically closed in Java 7. So...

try (Connection conn = ConnectionFactory.createConnection(conf); Table t = conn.getTable(TABLE_NAME)

{ ... }

is a shortcut for

Connection conn = null;
Table t = null;
try {
ConnectionFactory.createConnection(conf);
Table t = conn.getTable(TABLE_NAME) { ... }

finally

{ if (conn != null) conn.close(); if (t != null) t.close(); }

There is no explicit finally needed with Closables... Does that sound reasonable?

I still have quite a bit to do with this patch, apparently. Tests are failing. I might reduce the scope of the commit so that the tests don't fail.
Thank you for the try-with-resources note Solomon Duskis (http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/tryResourceClose.html) I did not know about it. Pardon my ignorance.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: This change was made obsolete by other patches.
